sentences.english: Rarr; So I chaffed them because I didn't believe their words.
sentences.chinese: 於是我揶揄他們因爲我不相信他們的話。

sentences.english: The time has passed when he was an object of ridicule.
sentences.chinese: 他受人揶揄譏嘲的時代已經過去了。

sentences.english: So I chaffed them because I didn't believe their words.
sentences.chinese: 於是我揶揄他們因爲我不相信他們的話。

sentences.english: His humorous rhymes were, however, more often quips and cranks at the expense of his contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 不過，他的幽默詩句更多是對同輩人的揶揄和打趣。

sentences.english: The opposition ridiculed the government's proposals, saying they often have nothing new.
sentences.chinese: 反對派揶揄政府的建議，說成是老調重彈。

sentences.english: This is often a time of much teasing and trash-talking among league members.
sentences.chinese: 這往往是聯盟成員間大肆揶揄與說垃圾話的時刻。

definition: to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
